newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to begin roadshow for global bond Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to begin roadshow for global bond Tuesday.

text.p: Brazil officials will meet with investors in New York on Tuesday on the first leg of a roadshow for the nation's upcoming global bond, which may be traded for existing Brady debt, a Central Bank spokesman said.
Central Bank International Affairs Director Gustavo Franco will head the Brazil team, which will travel to Boston on Wednesday and London on Thursday, the spokesman said.

Brazil announced last week that it would offer to buyback its "C", Discs and Par bonds or swap those Brady instruments for a new 30-year global bond. Part of the new global bond can also be bought outright with cash, it said.
The bank will take bids from investors through June 3 and announce the results the next day.
The Central Bank has not set a limit on the deal, with market expectations ranging from $1 billion to $4 billion.
